title: FOI request: Modern slavery training provision

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. This request relates to the training offered to staff on modern slavery. Please share the details of training on modern slavery delivered to staff, including:
- The nature of training offered (e.g. e-learning or in-person, shared with housing staff or adult safeguarding etc) and whether themes of cultural intelligence, equality, diversity and inclusion are included as part of this training
- Where held, please share copies of training materials used to support council staff in identifying modern slavery (such as PDFs, guidance, or presentations)
Yours faithfully,
Maya Esslemont

Dear Maya Esslemont,
Thank you for your request for information relating to modern slavery
training provision which we received on 24/11/2023.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you
within 20 working days, by 22/12/2023. Please do not hesitate to contact
us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear Maya Esslemont,
Thank you for your request for information relating to modern slavery
training provision which we received on 24/11/2023.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
Question:
Please share the details of training on modern slavery delivered to staff,
including: The nature of training offered (e.g. e-learning or in-person,
shared with housing staff or adult safeguarding etc) and whether themes of
cultural intelligence, equality, diversity, and inclusion are included as
part of this training.
Answer:
Sheffield City Council have previously provided two modern slavery
training packages on our online training system, one for all staff, and
one specifically tailored for those with a safeguarding background. Themes
of cultural sensitivity, diversity and inclusion were included in the
packages, but also linked to wider mandatory equalities training. In
addition, this year we have introduced, a number Modern Slavery seminars,
delivered by guest speakers from South Yorkshire Police. The first of
these was delivered during safeguarding week and we have two other
sessions planned between January and July. We have attached the power
point used during the first session.
Please note that the names of individuals have been redacted under section
40(2) of the Freedom of Information Act 2000 on the grounds that these are
personal data and disclosure would contravene the data protection
principle under Article 5(1)(a) of the General Data Protection Regulation
that processing of personal data must be fair, lawful and transparent.
Question:
Where held, please share copies of training materials used to support
council staff in identifying modern slavery (such as PDFs, guidance, or
presentations)
Answer:
We have recently changed our online learning provider and couldn’t bring
with us the modern slavery training package we previously used. We are
currently appraising options to replace this and hopefully will have an
e-learning package available in the not-too-distant future.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[2]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
